Description: Faience lentoid flask; moulded; well preserved light blue glaze; one broad face decorated in brown black paint with two cross hatched bands on shoulder, the other face with horizontal bands above framed petal band; traces of floral design above bands on both faces; framed wavy line along narrow face; possible join of two moulded halves visible in crack running along narrow edge.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 170)
